author: Emma Martinez
title: chevron-right
text: Metro Police arrested a man Wednesday after witnessing an apparent drug transaction. Detectives have been searching forAlbin Avdiu after a warrant was issued related to the shooting of a 30-year-old Nashville man on Monday. Avdiu was spotted Wednesday on Kendall Park Drive where police followed him to Murfreesboro Pike. Metro Police report officers then found him conducting an alleged drug deal. Back up was called, but Avdiu managed to evade them. Spike strips were deployed and he was chased until he was finally caught in a backyard on Griggs Place where he was taken into custody. Police searched his car and found 4.7 grams of blue powder that tested positive for fentanyl, about 800-900 pills, which also tested positive for fentanyl, various other pills and a loaded handgun. They also searched Avdiu’s house where they found two rifles, numerous loaded magazines, a money counter and $7,210.50 cash. Avdiu is being charged with attempted murder and reckless endangerment from the Aug. 5 shooting. He is also being charged with felony drug possession, evading arrest and gun possession during the commission of a felony from Wednesday’s events. He is jailed on $385,000 bond.
